unnormalised: ## Finding Balance: My Journey with Ayurveda Treatments
normalised: ## Finding Balance: My Journey with Ayurveda Treatments

unnormalised: Life in bustling Mumbai can leave you feeling frayed. The constant rush, the blare of horns, the sheer energy of the city - it’s exhilarating, but also exhausting. Lately, I felt my doshas completely out of whack! I was constantly tired, prone to headaches, and my digestion was a mess. My friend, Priya, noticed and suggested I explore Ayurveda.
normalised: Life in bustling Mumbai can leave you feeling frayed. The constant rush, the blare of horns, the sheer energy of the city - it’s exhilarating, but also exhausting. Lately, I felt my doshas completely out of whack! I was constantly tired, prone to headaches, and my digestion was a mess. My friend, Priya, noticed and suggested I explore Ayurveda.

unnormalised: Honestly, I was a bit skeptical. I’d always associated Ayurveda with old traditions and complicated remedies. But Priya, a staunch believer, swore by it. She told me about her transformative experience at the Kerala Ayurveda Ashram near Kochi, a place she visited every year around Diwali for a rejuvenating Panchakarma treatment. She booked her next appointment for 20/10/2024 and urged me to try even just a consultation.

She booked her next appointment for twentieth October two thousand and twenty four and urged me to try even just a consultation.

unnormalised: So, I decided to give it a shot. I found a local Ayurvedic doctor, Dr. Sharma, in Bandra. He spent a good 90 minutes during my initial consultation on 10/07/2024, asking about my lifestyle, diet, and medical history. He even checked my pulse, a technique I found fascinating! He diagnosed a Vata imbalance and recommended a diet plan, herbal remedies like Ashwagandha and Triphala, and a weekly Abhyanga massage. He also suggested a 7 AM yoga session.

He also suggested a seven A M yoga session.

unnormalised: The first week was tough. Cutting out my usual spicy street food (I love my pani puri!) and trying to wake up at 6 AM felt like a monumental task. But slowly, I started noticing a difference. My headaches lessened, my digestion improved, and I felt a sense of calm I hadn't experienced in ages. The Abhyanga massage with warm sesame oil was heavenly, easing the tension in my muscles.

The Abhyanga massage with warm sesame oil was heavenly, easing the tension in my muscles.

unnormalised: It’s been about a month since I started my Ayurvedic journey. I’m not completely cured, of course, but I feel significantly better. I still have those days when I crave that Vada Pav, but I try to balance it out with a healthy dose of kitchari and a mindful walk. I'm even considering a longer Ayurvedic retreat sometime next year. Maybe I'll join Priya in Kerala on 15/11/2025! Ayurveda is definitely a lifestyle change, a journey towards finding balance and harmony within myself. And it all started with just one consultation at 11:00 hrs.
